reviews.review_msg: Katz notes are very unorganized, no power points, just writes words on paper and shows it to the class. Irrationally jumps from topic to topic so its gets confusing. His test are quite tricky and weirdly marked. Most likely have to rely on TAs and textbook to understand topics. Though the textbook is extremely boring and can complicate concepts

I am delighted to have ended this course w a good mark however material itself was not easy. TAs were slow when it came to marking and though we had 3 weeks to complete each assignment, you cant count on TAs to also get back to you within the time frame, it was at least 1.5 month wait for a mark. Simon was accommodating and pretty approachable tho.

Lectures were engaging. The final was fair and reflected the lectures and assignments. There are 3 assignments worth 15%, 15%, and 20% respectively which take a very long time to complete (30-50+ hr), but we are given 3 weeks to complete each one. Work on them everyday for a few hours. Little feedback is given back. Self-teach through the textbook.

Simon has engaging lectures and makes otherwise boring topics fun to learn about. What students are expected to know for assignments and examinations is made very clear.

As other reviews mentioned, he does go into tangents about niche topics, but they're always quite informative, so I wouldn't necessarily list this as a bad quality of his.

No feedback whatsoever on assignments and slow responding to emails. Ta's try to explain the criteria in tutorials but it ultimately dosen't matter as feedback on the previous assignment is given when the next one was submitted, thus you have no real chance of improving the way you do them. And feedback itself is generic and not directed towards u
She's the best
Do not take this class. Her explanations are all over the place, not only that but TAs are no help. Regret taking this class.

I am in her PHIL105 class and she goes very slowly. Without showing up to a single tutorial, I've had no problem getting an A on the tests. Most of the class was common sense so long as you can remember the important vocabulary. Although her slow progression through the material is boring, it is very clear and you are sure to understand it.

in my opinion, the material of this class is not hard but super confused. it is important to have a tutor outside of school if you want a good grade.  but the professor is suck!! she is not nice at all!! she used the words such as " don't bother your TA""that's not you business""i'm not repeating myself" and reject to answer you or help you.

Although attendance was optional for tutorials I do recommend you attend them, because the content is heavy and confusing. Class average was 40%; it was a difficult course. She essentially read off her written notes during lectures which she emailed us each week. If you're confused, GO AND SEE YOUR TA because the grading criteria is very specific.

DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE. Her lectures completely suck. Either you skip, or fall asleep during lecture. The exams are tough, very hard to understand, and are set up so that you fail. Unless you are going into phil, DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE. Trust me!! you will fail or get a D. Hardest class ever. harder than calc...

The subject matter she teaches is very difficult but I think she is doing her best. There is every opportunity to go to her or a TA with any issues you are having. She is also pretty friendly albeit intimidating. In this case blame the course not the teacher.

One of my biggest regrets in life is taking this class. I took this as an elective thinking it would be fun to learn but the information is too dense and her slides aren't engaging at all. She goes really fast during lecture and does't make her notes fillable on word so its hard to keep up. If you're thinking of taking this class, DO NOT.

Such an incredible professor!! His lectures are engaging, humorous, and comprehensive. I really like the way he encourages questions and reviews all the knowledge before a test. If you are taking this course, be extra prepared on the first midterm, pay attention in class you are sure to pass with high marks. Good luck!!
one of the best professors at FIC, his lectures are interactive and fun
The best professor in FIC. He is very nice and always makes the course fun even though critical thinking may be a complicated lesson, but I would love to take his class again! !

Ian is the best professor I have had during my time at FIC. The way he gives his lectures makes his class very interesting and funny. Final exam was definitely tricky but as long as you understand the subject you will be okay.

Phil is one of the best professor I've ever met. His lectures are very fun and he is very engaging to his students, explaining the materials clearly in class and have clear expectations. Participation really matters in the class and it will also really help you in the course. Attend office hours when you have questions, and you'll be fine.
Ian is passionate about his course concepts. Acknowledges mental illness. Do not hesitate to go and talk during office hours. Read the book appropriately, PLEASE.
Phil 105 is a great GPA booster. Just read all the definitions in the textbook, learn to do all the calculations and do all the assignment and you will get a good grade.

Ian is a good teacher, a great teacher even. However, the course is outlined in a very messy way that is confusing. Also, he grades on very few things so be ready to put your 110% for those quizzes and tests.

He explains the concepts pretty clearly and is interesting that makes students understand more about the textbook. Just the tests are quite harder than the lectures, but trying to understand the concepts from his lecture and participating in the class will get a good grade.
perfect
Ian is the best philosophy professor ever. If you have a chance to take his class, take it! He loves what he teaches and his lectures are super interesting.

Ian's teaching is really Awesome, I really loved it .Exams are easy if we revise all the topics and look at his lectures. He is very kind and helps us with the doubts we have. Ian makes the class so interesting although I took an Asynchronous class I enjoyed listening to his lectures.

He is probably the best professor I have had so far. His energy in lectures really highlights the enthusiasm he has for the course. Clear & detailed explanations. He is very caring and he gives solid feedback. Struggling with something? Don't worry, he will always have your back. If you want to take PHIL105, pick him!

A real gem of a professor. You can really tell he loves his subject by the enthusiasm he shows in his lectures. He is quite understanding of student difficulties and is very supportive. Quizzes are in line with what is taught in the textbook and what is asked for group assignments. One drawback was that marks are never revealed after quizzes

I cannot come up with one bad thing about Ian. He is so passionate about teaching, and he always gives extra extra extra examples whenever you ask for it. Easy exams compared to in-class examples. If you listen to the lectures carefully, no textbook and extra homework exercises needed. Just take him!

Ian is the best teacher I've ever had. He is super friendly and also very humourous. I just love attending his lectures. PHIL105 is not that difficult course except for the probability numericals but they will also become easy if you follow Ian's teachings. Overall, this course was pretty fun with Ian.
A great prof indeed. He cares about his students and his classes are helpful. The course may be difficult for non-English students but he explains a lot.
awesome teacher , moderate exam level but has issues on attendance.

Ian is very patient with his students, and he gives lots of examples to explain the terms or concepts in his lectures. The midterms (2) are pretty easy, and there is a participation component. Best choice for PHIL105

Lyle felt no sympathy during a difficult time, refusing to give an exam extension. As a disabled student trying to attend law school, this was extremely difficult. An otherwise straight-A semester was ruined. I had to jump through many extra hoops to make my dream happen. Someone should refuse him a small kindness that costs him 100x more pain.
Him and Dr. Calico could be twins, he tried really hard even though the material is dry as toast. The project was confusing.
Grading is super subjective. TA is the worst, nitpicking kind

I took Phil 105 for a Q credit and would recommend it to others who are looking for a low stakes Q class.  Lyle's lectures do tend to drag on, but the only thing you need to do to succeed is review the course manual (and do ALL the practice questions bc they are the same on the tests) before exams and you will do fine!

Attendance isn't mandatory but you get marks if you're in the lecture and do the iClickers. Lyle takes something that can be easily explained and explains it in a way that in the end makes the whole chapter extremely difficult. The class notes "clear" imo and just confuses me even more. Literally, a YouTube explains it 10 times better than Lyle.

-As long as you read and understand the textbook, its pretty easy
-The final exam was kinda tough

-w teacher
-engaging class

This was a good professor but sometimes a bit hard to understand during lectures. Course followed a course manual that was a bit difficult to understand but had all the information you needed to succeed in the course. Easy to succeed if you do the practice in the manual as it is exactly what is on the exams

He was honestly a great prof, even though I struggle with English and social subjects, it was pretty fun, interesting, and easy to learn. There are Iclicker quizzes during lectures, but only 7% of grade. Every business student that needs an English/Phil class for requirement, this is great and highly recommended, best class by far.

The material interested me, including the textbook. But when 120 min feels like an eternity, something is wrong! The lecture slides felt incomplete and dry. I love philosophy, but not enough to sit through these lectures.

By far the worst Phil prof I have had at SFU. The lectures are disorganized and confusing and his condescending responses are totally uncalled for. I could have studied until the cows came home and it wouldn't have made a difference. Extremely hard material with terrible lectures and an impossible hard midterm. GPA killer.

Lyle is an overall great guy who is both a great person and great teacher. His lectures are interesting and engaging making it very easy to follow and learn the content. Exams are very fair and are formatted identical to the practice exams that are provided.

Lyle is completely full of himself. He's unapproachable and dismissive, acting like he's above answering student questions. He seems more interested in showing off how much he knows than actually teaching. The TA is just as bad, clueless about the material and totally unhelpful. Save yourself and avoid this class.

contrary to popular opinions, i actually thought this was one of the most straightforward classes ive ever taken. the second half of the sem was harder than the first (only because math was introduced and i suck at math), but my grade was an 100 before the final. slides arent posted because its completely unnecessary (course manual explains all)

Prof Lyle's philosophy class is a challenging but rewarding experience. His lectures can be tricky to follow, but his custom course manual with practice exams is super helpful. Unstuck AI and regular study sessions made a big difference for me.

While some of the concepts are difficult, Lyle puts a lot of effort into making the course as concise and easy to understand as possible. He made lectures engaging and fun. He was quite organized and straightforward which was helpful. He also gave a generous amount of time to complete the assignments.

The course material is difficult to understand, and the tests are based on the course manual. Clicker questions were given in every lecture to enforce participation. Lecture slides are not posted, and some content isn't taught directly, requiring students to read the manual, think critically, and practice. I wouldn't take this class again.
Really light workload! The lectures were engaging. He doesn't make you buy a textbook and provides you with condensed notes and tons of practice exams that are exactly what the exams are on.

Although Lyle is unironically funny, his course was kinda all over the place. The textbook is a course manual he wrote himself and it explains most of the concepts way better than he does in lecs(which are also kinda funny). however, he loves iClicker which sucks imo. USE THE PRACTICE TESTS IN THE COURSE MANUAL, they will help you sm on the tests.

The whole course was 2 assignments, a midterm, and a final. Probably the only course I could stand the whole 3 hour lecture. The workload for this course is probably the lowest I've ever had in other courses. Seriously amazing professor, would 100% recommend.

This guy is probably the least approachable professor I've taken so far, very belittling. Half the time if you asked the TA a question, they couldn't answer it. Not to mention this class is quite hard to comprehend, try to avoid this course at all costs. Hard marker, if your answer isn't perfect, it's wrong.

The content is so arbitrary, my TA does not know the answers to slides half of the time. Lyle uses crazy real world examples to illustrate concepts to the point it does not make sense. First midterm felt fair as it used practice exams in course manual, content is getting heavier and more confusing after midterm. Avoid if you can.

Dr. Crawford was very engaging in his lectures and provided many examples of how to apply various methods, but, with many of the concepts following the midterm (the midterm and its contents are much easier than what comes after) he didn't always clearly explain concepts, he just provided many examples. Just make sure you study using practice exams
Marking depends on subjective whims of TAs

He's an amazing professor, he grades very generously, he is super engaging. One thing I would recommend is to go to all the lectures as they're not only interesting but they contain a lot of necessary information.
Really good at explaining concepts, which are already really simple. The exams are basically the same questions as the practice exams he gives you. This is the easiest course I've ever taken
Not very good at explaining things
Lyle is a pretty bad teacher. Only good thing about him is his beard haha
Lyle does not care about his students.  Does not respond to emails or post slides. Very subjective grading and course material is pretty useless when it comes to actual critical thinking
He is rude and does not know how to respect the students. DO NOT TAKE HIS COURSE.
Grading is very subjective. Lyle does not respond to emails

average for the final was 57%. very unclear grading scale, didnt respond to my email. do all the practice exams!!! i did all of them and still ended up with mid 60s on final, midterm was easier. 2 assignments that were easy (25% of grade). midterm worth 30%, final worth 35%. 
lyle has a very boring voice

Nice guy but the course itself isn't the best. Tends to spend too long on off-topics and the course content/grading can be very subjective. Doesn't post slides but has a custom course manual. READ EVERYTHING in it because tests will focus on VERY specific sections, which lowered my mark because I did the practice only, which I thought was enough.
This is a critical thinking course where you don't actually Learn to think critically
Lyle does not respond well to student questions and feedback. Terrible teacher overall

Boring lectures and tutorials. Grading for the assignments is very arbitrary and subjective. Other than the logic covered in the initial weeks, the rest of the material is pretty subjective and useless.

Great Prof. Free textbook which is concise, to the point and has 3-5 practice exams (similar to real exams) per unit. Iclicker (like kahoot) in lectures for participation. Lectures are great - helpful, funny, interesting, relevant to real world. IMO, everyone should take this class - fundamentals that will help you for the rest of your life.

- Nice professor although he complicates concepts (difficult to understand his explanations/lessons) 
- No textbook only a course manual that he wrote
- Be prepared to teach yourself everything
- 2 tests = 65% (similar to practice questions in the manual) - still hard!
- iclicker marks for lecture participation 
- 2 assignments = 25% (kinda fun)

Lyle seems a nice guy! He is very passionate about philosophy but expresses it in a obtuse way making his content and lectures difficult to navigate. He writes his own text book with practice exams, which would be nice if i the examples werent WACK... his lectures sound like the teacher from charlie brown so ggs if you have a short attention span

Super nice prof, seems like a chill guy however his content and lectures are very hard to follow. There's no textbook for this class and he makes his own course manual instead (with typos.....). He provides practice exam questions in the course manual that are helpful but his exams are still difficult regardless. Tough grader for the exams too. ://

I am always confused during this man's lectures, I recommend being really proactive with your approach to learning the material as well as looking for outside sources to help you understand his lessons.

The first prof I have ever rated. I have never missed any of his lectures and had easy approach for questions or concerns. He is funny, enthusiastic and truly care for our study. The content of the course is a bit challenging but with the help of prof Lyle and TA, it's such a great studying experience I have had at SFU so far.

Tbh as a 1st year student Lyle is my fav prof!! He offers his own course manual filled w/ a bunch of practice exams which are basically identical to the midterm/final. The material itself can get a little confusing but w/ practice this is an easy class to succeed in. 10/10 would reccomend just the iClicker questions can sometimes get tricky.

Good prof. Assignments were easy. Iclicker in class but u can stay home and try guessing answers from phone. No textbook, he provides his own book and its free. Only 2 exams and its a bit hard. You have to reread some chapters as they are confusing. However, practice exams in his book are exactly the same on test. Do practice exam = do good on test

Lyle was awesome! He wrote his own textbook (free) and the lectures and exams revolved around it. All of the concepts were thoroughly covered in lectures and tutorials. The practice exams in the textbook were GODSENT as they were almost identical to the actual exams. If you do most of the practice questions correctly, you will do well on the exam

Lyle is one of my least favourite prof, his lecture is awful and despite him laughing at his own jokes you leave the class unaware of how to proceed. The textbook is written by Lyle so if you thought the lecture was bad now you're really in for it. There is a tone of practice question for the exams but the text is very hard to follow and understand
great guy. responds to emails within an hour. easy class if you read the textbook. he wrote the textbook so he is very knowledgable on it

Lyle is a good prof and teaches very well, however, the material often gets confusing. He attempts to explain it in simple terms and is helpful but you have to go over the material a couple times to understand it completely. His exams are literally the practice exams in his course manual, do them multiple times and you'll do well!

Great prof. In class examples really help you understand the concepts and do well on the exams. 

He also give you a course manual instead of a textbook. Use it, very informative.
decent class, professor clearly explained the material but nothing too special about him or notable to make the course outstanding. lectures were boring and most only showed up due to iclicker.
Made somewhat boring course material funny and engaging for the whole 2 hours. Tests were somewhat difficult but overall the course had little homework, just 2 projects and 1 midterm.

Lyle's lectures were organized with clear explanations and examples. Falling behind is not an option as the course moves fast and concepts are interconnected. Use the practice exams in the course manual, they are exactly like the real exams. Regularly meeting with my TA was what got me my grade, so make sure to take advantage of their office hours!

Lyle does a great job of explaining and teaching, and his (free) textbook will help you understand anything else you didn't get in lecture. He's very clear about what you're expected to know, and tests you on that only. I would recommend taking PHIL105 with him

He uses iClicker which is the only thing that I really didn't like, since he marked some trick questions for correctness. There's 2 easy assignments that you have a lot of time to do, but marks are returned very slowly. His lectures are interesting and often funny. But you learn the most from his textbook and the included practice exams.

Lyle is a good professor who is quite knowledgeable. PHIL 105 was a fairly difficult course at times, but I thought he did a good job explaining tricky concepts with real world examples and videos. As expected with a tricky course, the grading was fairly difficult and the average for the exams were quite low.

lyle is good prof however he does mark hard for the assignments. overall, the class is good you just got to review the textbook he provides. the only thing i didn't like were the iclickers and that were for marks. his slides are good but the textbook helped me throughout the course!

Decent. Lecture is only kind of helpful but unfortunately mandatory as he grades participation partially on iClicker questions in class. The key to doing well is reading the textbook and doing the practice exams as his exams are basically the same but worded differently. Kind of sounds like John Mulaney
Super confusing lectures that he doesn't even post afterward. TA's are not helpful.

Lyle seems really nice but he taught the course in a way where he made the concepts seem harder than they actually were. I enjoyed his slides but he didn't post them and it was also nearly impossible to take notes. If you want to do good, make sure you read the manual and do the practice exams.

Lyle is an interesting prof. Lectures are pretty interesting and don't get discouraged like I was in the first couple of weeks! Make sure to read the course manual and DO THE PRACTICE EXAMS. That's all the exams were. iClicker questions in lectures are unnecessary and have an effect on your grade which is annoying.

The textbook was written by him and has practice exams which reflect the actual exams. Make sure you do them because they are helpful since the lectures can sometimes be confusing. Also, attend lectures because he has iClicker questions that count toward your grade. There are two small assignments that are mark boosters if you put in the effort.

I loved how Lyle wrote the course book for this class, as it was super easy to understand. His exams were pretty fair, considering it was based off his practice exams, and the assignments were pretty easy. PARTICIPATION MATTERS! The one thing I hated about his class were the in class iClicker questions, as I did not think it was fair at all.

Professor Crawford is awesome! He explains concepts clearly and does his best to ensure that everyone has a fair chance at succeeding. Exams and assignments are simple as long as you go to class and read the course manual, especially the practice exams! He's really helpful during office hours too, plus 10/10 powerpoint slides! Definitely recommend!

Lyle is fantastic! His lectures are very engaging, content is super interesting! This course was the right level of challenging, I had to put in effort to understand but was able to figure it out. He wrote the textbook, it's easy to understand, he provides a free pdf copy. Tips: Practice exams are great to prepare for exams & read TB before class!

Lyle was a decent but very fair professor. Lectures were pretty boring and hard to pay attention in. However, PHIL 105 is one of the classes where it's very manageable to teach yourself. Lyle self writes his textbook with tons of practice exams. MT and Final were simply those with different wordings. 2 easy assignments.

Lyle is really great, you can tell that he genuinely cares about the content of the class. His slides are super detailed which makes the lectures entertaining and his exams are really fair, identical to the practice exams in the manual. He's very nice during office hours and explains concepts super in-depth to make sure people understand. 10/10!

This course was extremely difficult if you do not read the course manual provided!! His lectures are extremely draining and packed with information. His examples are much more complicated than the concept itself making it hard to understand. He also uses iClicker so be prepared to buy that. He does not record lectures or hand out lecture slides.

He is a really funny guy, but unless you love philosophy it will be very difficult. Most students leave the lecture confused and not understanding anything that just went on. READ!! He gives you the course manual, and you need to use it. Overall, I would not take this course again, but really nice guy.

Lyle was very funny and interacted a lot with students during the online lectures; However, me and my friends found the contend very confusing most of the time, and it only got worse after each lecture.

PHIL105 is a very interesting course if you're comfortable with a bit of logic and patterns. The material is not too difficult and it's made a lot easier through Lyle's lectures and by putting in some work. If you want to do well, take it seriously, read the course manual, absolutely do practice exams, and ask questions if you didn't get it right.

Lyle is a very caring instructor. I really appreciated that he held super tutorials before the exams as they were a great review of the material. If you want to do well in this class, read the course manual sections prior to class. The slides are easy to follow. Would recommend as he genuinely cared about helping and wants people to do well!

Read the course manual! He goes out of his way to ensure you know what youre doing and shows this by doing super tutorials and office hours are informative and updates the manual often to make the material easier to digest. Explains a small bit of logic but does in a way thats easy to understand. Get familiar with Bayes Theorem & youll be golden
Personally hated this class. The content was boring and the grading made no sense to me. You also don't get any feedback/comments when your assignments get graded. Would not recommend.

OK so I think Lyle is a great guy and really cares about what he teaches. But WOW hands down this is the most needlessly difficult level 100 class that is available at SFU. If you don't need to take this class. Don't. Oh yeah, did I mention you don't know what your grade REALLY is before the end of the class? Yeah this should be a skip.

Make sure you know the material! It is a confusing course and the TAs seem confused as well, so I recommend doing the practice exams because his tests are based on the practice questions. His lectures use iclicker, so if you want to do well you should read the textbook before the lecture. The material is fun once you get to know it!

It was very confusing. The first classes seem pretty okay but it just gets worse after that, most people from my tutorial and I were confused about the material. Me and my friends who took the course struggled to understand lectures and almost failed. A lot of effort to get the bare minimum. Lyle is very nice but the subject itself isnt.
Lyle puts a lot of time and effort into his slides and presenting them. Lyle handled online teaching better than any other professor I know and his assignments and exams are fair.

Wouldn't record lectures and the extra tutorials which were held outside of class time. Didn't give feedback on the grade received for ANY exams or assignments (you end up having no idea where you lost points). Laughs at students for asking questions, but otherwise explains well and the exams are easy because the textbook is very similar. iClicker.

Lyle is a great teacher with lots of enthusiasm. He makes sure to teach his classes very well to make learning really easy. If you pay attention to the lectures and attend his super tutorials before tests, you will be just fine in the class. 10/10 would take again.

Lyle is a great prof! He usually pushes you to think for yourself while lectures which aides learning and prepares you well for exams. Participate actively in class since interaction is a big component while lectures and will help you do better. Overall, it is NOT a tough course, as long as you pay attention and read the course manual he provides.
One of the best courses I have ever taken at SFU. Lyle really spends time teaching and making sure his students understand the concepts. I would recommend him to everyone.

Lyle is a talented lecturer, but his course is very hard. This course requires lots of reading but Lyle never provided a reading week which caused many students to fall behind including myself. His super tutorials are helpful and he is definitely available outside of class, but as a full time student it may not be worth enrolling in this class.

Lyle as a prof keeps you engaged and is a super down to earth dude, but be sure to pay attention to lectures since your clicker questions are worth marks. His textbook is your holy bible and as long as you religiously read the book, you will do good! I wish I would've paid attention to class and opened the textbook sooner.
Doesn't post lectures or slides

Overall a fun and informative class. Lectures and tutorials were well organized. The textbook he wrote is your holy grail, study it and you will be fine. He is super easy-going, loves to help students. He spends 3-4 hours outside lecture times to host supertutorials to prepare us for each exam. I've never met a professor who does that!

This class will test your knowledge and grasp of the topics and not your ability to just memorize and regurgitate facts. Lyle was very responsive to questions in lecture and was always available after lec to explain and clarify any questions students had. Exams were very FAIR, you will know what is expected of you. Read the textbook & complete Qs.

I've found the class easy and generally interesting enough to pay attention in lectures. The grading scale is mostly exam based, which as long as you show up to class and tutorials and read the textbook (which is written by him and not a lot of material to cover nor is it difficult to read), you will probably end up doing better than average.

This course helps improve your intuitive thinking and understanding of the world. If you can multiply fractions and remember a few simple formulas you'll do fine. The participation marks are based on handing in tutorial assignments. Do most of the textbook questions as they are very helpful and you will see similar questions on the exams.

This can be considered a non-writing philosophy course. READ the textbook! Ensure you understand the materials well, don't just memorize them. Make good use of the practice questions at the end of each unit. Exams are not cumulative but require a basic understanding of previously tested materials. He held super tutorials before exams as well.

All the examples he used in class are very interesting and relevant. As an international student, it can be a little challenging to understand everything. But NEVER HESITATE to ask him for clarification through email or office hour. He appears to be responsive and patient. In Zoom class, his audio and cam are better quality compared to other profs.

The book is very helpful with all the information you will need. You will do well on the exam if you study the practice questions from the book since exam questions will be similar. PPT slides in class are mainly for interactive purposes, and he made it very engaging with visual effects. You do not need the slides to study. THE BOOK HAS EVERYTHING.

This is a 50 mins class, which is why the exams are around 40 mins. This is a critical thinking philosophy course, not a math class. Exams are usually a few short paragraphs questions. Enough time to answer if you study well, just like ALL other courses. He cares about his teaching a lot, very accessible, responds to email fast and very caring.

he is very unorganized and is very unaccommodating towards students. his exams are around 40 mins-1 hr with heavy, paragraph-like questions and zero time to read/answer them. he has 3-2 different exams with different amounts of questions. he doesn't care for international students at all. blames students for not "studying enough." gpa dropper.

Lyle is nice but he is the worst Prof I ever had. I took this class-online and his lectures were content-heavy but he won't let you record his lecture nor will he post his lecture slides w/o the recording because he claims "it took him a long time to create this presentation". He is very unaccommodating and does not care for international students

Excellent professor!! He will never leave the room until he knows you understand. Class is good, lots of interesting topics. He always changes his lecture slides to relevant topics. He is a dedicated prof, very hardworking

The course was like made up by him I swear, he uses his own textbook overall the course was pointless. Show up to tutorials because they are more helpful than his lecture and do the practice questions in his book. The lectures themselves were boring and useless.
Lyle is a very logical person. I found that very helpful for me, but your experience may differ. He is passionate about teaching, 10/10 would recommend.

Really great teacher, writes and provides his own textbook for free. The lectures were really interesting and helped provide a lot of clarity to the contents of the course. Course material can get a little confusing but Lyle is very accessible and is interested in every students success. Only cons were a bad TA and clicker is used for attendance.

A real professional. You can tell that he has put a lot of effort into his slides, (free) textbook, course material, and lectures. This translates very well for your ability to learn. One thing is that the participation marks aren't based on how much you talk in tut, but if you hand in assignments. I talked all the time but got below avg marks :(

Lyle's lectures are simple. His exams are fair, but the material is difficult and confusing but you will do well if you just FINISH ALL THE WORKSHEET PROBLEMS IN HIS TEXTBOOK. He's a caring prof, likes to talk to his students and crack jokes. The class didn't work too well for me but if I could take Lyle as a prof in a different course I would!

he is a nice prof and has extra review sessions before midterms and finals that are helpful. tutorials help with understanding course material. however course material is super super confusing and it is difficult. need to practice a lot and get help when u need it. i took this course thinking it would be a gpa booster and easy but it is not lol

His lectures are fun and easy to understand. Tutorials are there to help reinforce the content from the textbook (textbook is free, btw). If you study the practice questions in the textbook, you'll do fine on the exams.

Lyle is a amazing professor. His Power Point is interesting and always has interaction with students while lecturing. His teaching style is simple that it's easy for students to understand the complicated concepts his teaching.

Incredible professor who is extremely well organized and does his part on making the content as clear as possible. But that doesn't mean that it was easy- content is confusing af especially in the beginning. But he was kind enough to hold extra review sessions before the midterm and the final. No doubt he's a great professor but

Lyle cares about how well he teaches, how practical his material is, and how he assesses you as a student. I found that his lectures were always valuable. His attitude for exams is to never surprise you - practice questions are reasonable and reflect what to expect on the exam. You can do well in this course if you put in the effort.

Good choice for a course. The prof wrote the textbook himself (it's a good textbook) and he models the exams extremely closely after practice questions. So as long as you're willing to put in a little work (nothing excessive - just do the readings and practice questions) you will learn what you're supposed to and do well in the course.

His PowerPoint slides are so much fun! I had a great time in this semester because of his class. As an international student, sometimes it is hard to understand some references or concepts. Do not hesitate to ask him or go to office hour if you need help.
He is a great professor who truly cares about the quality of his teaching. He put a lot of effort to make lectures fun. Awesome powerpoint skills. I have a pleasant learning experience in this class.

There is no question that Lyle is a good teacher. However, he is quite rude. Not very understanding of students who are from other countries and do not understand Western culture. International students beware, as he's not afraid to remind you that this is Canada. I really enjoyed Lyle and his teaching. However, it is hard to feel the same way now.

very organized, has the most entertaining and unique use of slides I've seen, and is seriously invested in the success of the students taking the course. He is VERY fair and provides you with a textbook. I must say, sometimes he doesn't explain the little things, but that's okay. Just make sure your not scrolling on fb in class, he will call u out.
This course with Lyle becomes easy for me and tbh, I still find its material in Lyles own textbook interesting and relevant to anyone who plans to take BUEC later

This course was really easy and Lyle's teaching was really interesting. The content could be a little confusing, but the amount of practice questions in the book really helped with understanding. The grading criteria was a bit confusing, but at the end of the day I'm satisfied with my mark.

This course was really interesting and useful. He also has a fun and interactive teaching style, would definitely recommend for anyone looking for electives. For people who have taken MACM 101 or any STAT course, this would be an even better choice.

His own book is great. He is a bit hard if you dont focus. A little quizz at the very start of everyday for attendance and bonus marks is on his book. If you try to listen and do all the practice he gives in the book, for sure youll get high marks! Lyle is a really cool teacher, also a really sympathetic instructor! Highly reccomend!

Amazing textbook which is written by himself. I took his class last term, I also took macm101 which is a required class for my major (CS). I found that it is great to take these two class in one semester. the part included in the first midterm of his course is really similar to the macm101 (also before the first midterm).

The course itself was hard. I didn't understand anything throughout the semester. I got saved by the scale. The exam questions were based off of the questions from his textbook. He tries to be funny in lecture. Overall, a great prof but the course was difficult.

Amazing Prof! He is funny and has great lectures. The course was extremely interesting with him. All his exams were based on a book he wrote. The book is free as a pdf. He is honestly great and I recommend him!

Lyle is one of the best profs I have had. His lectures are engaging and very useful to expand your knowledge on the content. His practice questions in the FREE textbook are practically copy and paste from his tests. But, the material is VERY difficult to understand and the final exam was the hardest exam of my life. But he does scale marks a lot.
I like his teaching style, very witty and fun, but the class itself is very difficult. Attended every class and tutorial and asked good questions, still don't understand the material.

DO PRACTICE QUESTIONS!! The tests and final exam are based on his practice questions! Lyle and the TAs are very approachable; ASK THEM WHEN YOU DON'T UNDERSTAND. HIGHLY RECOMMEND that you go to the tutorial too because the TAs do a good job at re-explaining them. Towards the final exam, he will hold EXTRA OFFICE HOURS, make good use of that!

His leatures are amazing! The PowerPoint technique is exceptional and super creative. Can see he is very passionate about what he is teaching. The textbook is separated into three parts and there is an answer key at the end of each part for the practice questions. He is very accessible through email and have regular office hours.

too much effort put into power points, not enough into making sure students understood concepts. took too long to explain things and was a fan of unnecessarily long winded and convoluted explanations that make it hard to understand him. textbook was written by him and pretty useless, it was filled w/errors and missing answers to practice questions

Lyle is amazing! I am taking a course with him right now and he's super funny, easy-going, accessible, creative and his power points are made in a way that engage you. He is a genius in terms of coming up with explanations in interactive and interesting ways. Absolutely loved his lectures.

Mr. Crawford is just simply fantastic. His lectures are clear, what he expects out of you is clear and his textbook is FREE as its online, and its practically a play by play to pass the rest. A truly amazing teacher! And the course was honestly fun, would reccomend him 10/10 100%

You just need to pay attention in class of what he is saying and do a lot of practice from his textbook then you can get good grades in this class. He is really caring try to reach every student to make sure that they understand the material.

Being an business student, I never thought that I will be so interested in philosophy. But luckily I found this instructor! Really though, his course is very interesting, definitely not boring. Great lecture, just make sure to listen to his explanation, otherwise it will be quite confusing. Overall recommended 10/10 :)
Good teacher, awesome grading

She's absolutely amazing professor , I absolutely love her. I wished she taught something other than philosophy so that i could that that course as well. To get a good grade in her class , you only need to focus on what she says , makes notes and READ THE TEXTBOOK. You can easily get A- and above in this course if you engage with her well.

Jennifer is very understanding, friendly, and teaches very well. However, classes sometimes don't feel very engaging even though she tries to keep it interesting. At times her explanations may not seem very clear. Overall, if you read the text and her slides you will do well.
Jennifer is very patient and her tests are fair. Make sure you study hard then you will definitely be fine in the exams. Don't hesitate to attend her office hours when you need help!

Her lecture and powerpoint slide is clear and easy to understand. Just focus on what she said in the class and you will be fine. All of her tests are mostly taken from class examples so you shouldn't skip the class. Working hard because her exams are pretty tricky.

The exams are quite tricky. You need to be clear of concepts and read the textbook to get a really good grade. Jennifer is good at explaining all the concepts and paying attention in her class does half the job.
Best one for Critical Thinking. Clear lectures and friendly. She also do explain detailedly about all ur questions. Just be aware of all those tricks in exams and a easy A.
She has magic power that can attract your attention. I love her.

Jennifer is an amazing instructor. She is inspiring and her exam is fair. Some necessary but not sufficient tips to perform well: Do not miss the class. Do the preview before the class. Listen to her seriously. Before the exam try to memorize and understand the "review" part each chapter. While doing the exam be much careful and cautious. Cheers.

Jennifer is a wonderful instructor and I miss the time learning with her. If you are hesitating choosing the instructor for PHIL105, I highly highly recommend you to choose her. For final I did not perform perfectly and made a lot of mistakes. An A is lucky and satisfactory. But today is the grade releasing day and it's A+. Thank you Jennifer :)

Jennifer is an amazing instructor and she deserves a higher (at least above 4.5) evaluation I think. Clear and interesting class. She is caring and glad to answer your questions. For this logic course I think understanding is the most important. Her test is not much hard but needs you to be really careful and earnest. Read her PPT slides repeatedly
She is one of the best philosophy instructors. Clear and nice. Love to study with her.

If you are in another major and want an elective that gets you the Q and Sci credits then do not take this class. If you are into Philosophy and it is your major, this is the perfect class for you as you will have to learn an insane amount. Pollon's same 105 course is way easier! I cannot stress this enough for non-Phil majors!!!!!!!

This is a difficult course, not what you'd expect. If you're considering taking 105 for a b-hum requirement, just don't. Do not. Seriously. There are easier & better phil/b-hum courses. Dr. Heide is fine, clearly knowledgable about the course and philosophy, but comes off performative and vain during lectures, and is unapproachable. Don't do it!
Nice guy, lectures are very clear. Its a 100 level phil class so not alot to say lol.

He's a charismatic guy, but he seems very uncooperative and unwilling to help often. Not only will he not take questions during break, he doesn't help during the exam either. He also seems quite arrogant, as he once bragged about how philosophy majors make above-average salaries compared to most people. Dude needs to simmer down with the hubris.

8 Quizzes (best of 5), 1 MT & Final. The 1st half of the course is about logic and arguments and the 2nd half is on probability. Tests were fair where half is MC and the other is written. If you thoroughly understand all of the concepts and calculation problems on his slides, then you'll most likely do well. Be prepared for word problems.
Not what i thought of a phil class but pretty ok. The TA is helpful, but the prof don't like y to ask him during break time

This was the worst class I took, as an international student trust me you will find it 10 times more difficult because of word problems. His book and lectures are poorly structured and he shows little respect or interest in helping the student. being good in math back in High School and having proficiency tests is not enough: the worst prof ever

Fun course and great prof. Despite not being mandatory, lectures are very helpful as well as entertaining. The second half of the course goes into probability, where the textbook readings can sometimes overcomplicate concepts. If you are weak with math word problems, this section will be tricky to grasp. Quizzes and exams are very fair.

Excellent at explaining concepts in propositional logic, inductive arguments, and probability. This class focuses heavily on word problems and math, so if you want an easier Q credit or an interesting elective, I would recommend this class. Tutorials were not useful (just review of previous lecture) but are mandatory because of weekly quizzes.

Would recommend if you're looking for slightly easier Q credit... First half of the course was mostly English stuff, second was probability. Tutorials felt like repetition of what had already been discussed in lecture and readings, but (very short) weekly quizzes were actually super helpful for ensuring consistent studying for exams.
He thoroughly explains all concepts and formulas with a ton of examples, and he adds some humour into there as well. Makes a super tough class manageable.

After reading reviews on here, I didn't think the class would be bad. TRUST ME if you're not strong in math and word problems, do not take this! On his syllabus he has "in class assignments" however are actually quizzes. Went to his office multiple times and is more robotic than friendly. Never met a prof like that before. Absolutely hated class.

Tim is definitely a genius. I mean literally. But he can't understand that most of his students are ordinary people. The exam is extremely difficult, and the unreasonable multiple-choice mechanism will make you extremely painful.
He is easy-going, approachable and delivers his lectures in a fun and engaging manner. You will do well in his course if you focus on his examples and stay up to date with the readings and homeworks.

Great prof. Literally changed the way I think, make decisions and think logically. I have started to implement what is taught in this course in my life which could only have been possible by the way Tim taught. Thanks Tim, for changing my worldview, if you read this.
Be prepared to fail. Teaches too fast. Doesn't explain clearly.
